dt: {bc}a trancelike state marked by loss of voluntary motion in which the limbs remain in whatever position they are placed

et: Middle English {it}catalempsi{/it}, from Medieval Latin {it}catalepsia{/it}, from Late Latin {it}catalepsis{/it}, from Greek {it}katalēpsis{/it}, literally, act of seizing, from {it}katalambanein{/it} to seize, from {it}kata-{/it} + {it}lambanein{/it} to take {ma}{mat|latch|}{/ma}
shortdef: a trancelike state marked by loss of voluntary motion in which the limbs remain in whatever position they are placed
